examples: We sequenced the code to keep it organised.
The later edition of the book sequenced the chapters differently, which caused a lot of confusion among non-technical readers.

definitions.definition: To determine the order of monomers in (a biological polymer ), e.g. of amino acids in (a protein ), or of bases in (a nucleic acid ).
To proceed through a sequence or series of things.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To arrange (something) in an order .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , biochemistry ) To determine the order of monomers in (a biological polymer ), e.g. of amino acids in (a protein ), or of bases in (a nucleic acid ).
( transitive , music ) To produce (music) with a sequencer .
( intransitive , uncommon ) To proceed through a sequence or series of things.
